result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM Defendant in court with atty Larry Pruden. ADA Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter on for Preliminary Hearing on 22CF9 with 21CF599 tracking. Matter is proceeding to preliminary hearing. State calls officer Antonio Gonzales and responds to direct exam of ADA Berg. Record to reflect witness id'd defendant. State's exhibit marked Exh #1, id'd. State moves Exh #1 into evidence, no objection. 
213 pm Cross exam by Atty Pruden.
215 pm Redirect by ADA Berg
216 pm Follow up by Atty Pruden. No follow up by ADA Berg
216 pm Witness excused.

218 pm Argument by Atty Pruden
Court finds probable cause felony committed; matter bound over for trial.
Parties proceed to arraignment; reading waived of Information,  not guilty pleas entered.
Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ronald A Bloom in court with attorney Larry R Pruden.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 21GF1294 & 21CF599
MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH N.L.H.    If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

21-5579 & 21-5580
Defendant Ronald A Bloom in court in custody via video with attorney Larry Pruden.  James Sempf for State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
